name: PowerShell
description: Run a PowerShell script on Windows, Mac, or Linux.
author: Microsoft Corporation
releaseNotes: Script task consistency. Added support for Mac and Linux.

inputs.name: script
inputs.label: Script
inputs.defaultValue:
# Write your powershell commands here.
# Use the Environment input below to map secret variables into environment variables.

Write-Host "Hello World"

inputs.name: errorActionPreference
inputs.label: ErrorActionPreference
inputs.helpMarkDown: Prepends the line `$ErrorActionPreference = 'VALUE'` at the top of your script.

inputs.name: failOnStderr
inputs.label: Fail on Standard Error
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, this task will fail if any errors are written to the error pipeline, or if any data is written to the Standard Error stream. Otherwise the task will rely on the exit code to determine failure.

inputs.name: ignoreLASTEXITCODE
inputs.label: Ignore $LASTEXITCODE
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is false, the line `if ((Test-Path -LiteralPath variable:\LASTEXITCODE)) { exit $LASTEXITCODE }` is appended to the end of your script. This will cause the last exit code from an external command to be propagated as the exit code of powershell. Otherwise the line is not appended to the end of your script.

inputs.name: workingDirectory
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Working directory where the script is run.

messages.JS_InvalidErrorActionPreference: Invalid ErrorActionPreference '%s'. The value must be one of: 'Stop', 'Continue', or 'SilentlyContinue'
messages.JS_Stderr: PowerShell wrote one or more lines to the standard error stream.
messages.PS_InvalidErrorActionPreference: Invalid ErrorActionPreference '{0}'. The value must be one of: 'Stop', 'Continue', or 'SilentlyContinue'
messages.PS_UnableToDetermineExitCode: Unexpected exception. Unable to determine the exit code from powershell.
